question: Question_01_(f)
hints:
Again, this is not a derivative we immediately know so we have to use
our toolbox of rules. Here, we have a composition of function so we use
the chain rule, which states:

If $h(x) = f(g(x))$ for differentiable \emph{f} and \emph{g}, then

$\displaystyle h'(x) = f'(g(x))g'(x)$
